items.title: Trump Administration Pauses Immigration From Afghanistan After D.C. Shooting
items.summary: The U.S. agency overseeing immigration made the announcement after an Afghan man shot two National Guard troops near the White House.

items.title: What We Know About the National Guard Shooting in D.C. and the Suspect
items.summary: Two National Guard members are in critical condition after a man shot them near the White House on the eve of Thanksgiving.

items.title: Before the Shooting, Some Troops and Officials Worried About the Guard’s Safety
items.summary: In an internal memo, Guard commanders warned that troops were in a “heightened threat environment.”

items.title: What Is Operation Allies Welcome, the Program That Gave Some Afghans Entry to the U.S.?
items.summary: The Biden administration set up the initiative after the Taliban retook power in Afghanistan in August 2021 for those who assisted U.S. troops.

items.title: Leaked Transcript of Witkoff Call Shows U.S. Deference to Russia
items.summary: The White House envoy’s conversation suggests that President Trump is determined to make a deal to end the war in Ukraine, even if it is mostly on Russia’s terms.

items.title: Trump Orders 500 More National Guard Troops to D.C. After Shooting
items.summary: The president described the shooting as an “act of terror” and “a crime against humanity” and called the suspect, an Afghan national, an “animal.”

items.title: National Guard shooting: Trump says US should ‘re-examine’ all Afghan refugees after suspect named
items.summary: <p>President calls the shooting in Washington an ‘act of terror’, as officials name Rahmanullah Lakanwal as suspected shooter</p><p>Donald Trump has called for his government to re-examine every Afghan immigrant who entered the US during Joe Biden’s administration, after law enforcement officials identified the suspect <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/26/national-guard-soldiers-shot-washington-dc">in the shooting of two national guard members</a> in Washington as a man from Afghanistan.</p><p>A statement from the Department of Homeland Security named the suspect asRahmanullah Lakanwal, a 29-year-old Afghan national who entered the US <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/aug/17/afghan-refugees-fund-joe-biden-sets-up">under a Biden-era policy allowing Afghans</a> set up after the <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/jun/30/us-afghanistan-war-military-pullout-report-biden-trump">US withdrawal from Afghanistan</a> in 2021. Immigration authorities granted Lakanwal asylum earlier this year, according to CNN.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/26/washington-national-guard-shooting-suspect">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Washington DC shooting: Trump calls shooting of national guard members ‘an act of terror’, vows new scrutiny of immigrants – as it happened
items.summary: <p>This live blog is now closed.</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/26/national-guard-soldiers-shot-washington-dc">Two West Virginia national guard members shot in Washington DC</a></p></li><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/26/trump-administration-news-at-a-glance-latest">Trump news at a glance: president orders more troops to Washington DC after shooting of national guard members</a></p></li></ul><p><strong>Bloomberg’s <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-11-25/witkoff-advised-russia-on-how-to-pitch-ukraine-plan-to-trump">scoop</a> showing how Trump aide</strong><strong> Steve Witkoff</strong><strong> coached the Kremlin on the best way to get into Trump’s good graces is extraordinary for what it tells us about Witkoff’s dubious loyalties, and the Kremlin’s potential influence over US negotiation efforts. But equally interesting is the leaked material itself and where it may have come from.</strong></p><p>The <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/25/trump-envoy-on-russia-ukraine-peace-deal">story covers two intercepted phone calls</a>: one between Witkoff and top Kremlin aide Yuri Ushakov, and another between Ushakov and Kirill Dmitriev, <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/nov/21/who-is-kirill-dmitriev-draft-plan-ukraine-war-russia">who has been deeply involved in negotiations</a> with the Trump White House.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/26/us-politics-latest-news-pete-hegseth-donald-trump-marjorie-taylor-greene-mark-kelly">Continue reading...</a>
